Package org.sopra.api.model

Interface EnergyNode

All Known Subinterfaces:
BioGasFiredPowerPlant, City, CoalFiredPowerPlant, CommercialPark, Consumer, ControllableConsumer, ControllableProducer, GasFiredPowerPlant, HydroPowerPlant, IndustrialPark, NuclearPowerPlant, Producer, SolarPowerPlant, TransformerStation, WindPowerPlant
public interface EnergyNode
Nodes in a scenario graph. These node represent actual places on the map. Therefore, they need a name and coordinates. The meaning of the energy level of an energy node is dependent on the dynamic type of the node.

If it is a consumer, the energy level is the amount of energy currently consumed.

If it is a producer, it is the amount of produced energy.

The maximum energy level has a similar meaning. It depicts the maximum amount of energy production/consumption, this node is capable of.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getEnergyLevel()
    Returns the current amount of energy production or consumption.
    int getMaximumEnergyLevel()
    Returns the maximum possible amount of energy production or consumption.
    java.lang.String getName()
    Returns the node's name.
    int getXPos()
    Returns the node's x-coordinate on the scenario's map.
    int getYPos()
    Returns the node's y-coordinate on the scenario's map.

      Returns the node's name.

      The node's name.

    • getXPos

    • getYPos

      int getYPos()

      Returns:

    • getEnergyLevel

      int getEnergyLevel()
      Returns the current amount of energy production or consumption.
      Returns:
      The current amount of energy production / consumption.

    • getMaximumEnergyLevel

      int getMaximumEnergyLevel()
      Returns the maximum possible amount of energy production or consumption. MaximumEnergyLevel is bigger or equal to the current EnergyLevel and the currently requiredPower/providedPower
      Returns:
      The maximum amount of energy production / consumption.
